result.execSummary:
The defendant Calvin D Marlow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
-Matter set for a Restitution Hearing. Spanish Interpreter will be needed for the victim.
*2/9/2016  Set at $2,597.50 as to Steve P.-P.  To be paid during term of Extended Supervision ordered during sentencing hearing.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; non payment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
-Obtain GED or HSED.

-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
-No contact with 
Steve P., Jeanette T., Darryl H., Willie M., Donte C.

-Cooperate with agent.
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes: -As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and school.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 8-21-2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Defendant Calvin D Marlow in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Calvin D Marlow in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 1/2  YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 1/2  YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS concurrent with COUNT 2, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 26 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution to be determined  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; non payment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Steve P., Jeanette T., Darryl H., Willie M., Donte C.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, Court ordered defendant serve 10 MONTHS in the House of Corrections, with Huber release privileges for work and school.  No good time credit.  No electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the House of Corrections on 8-21-2015 at 1:00 p.m.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS concurrent with COUNT 1, consecutive to any other sentence.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution to be determined  
-Defendant to pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments to be collected during term probation.  If defendant is revoked, all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; non payment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected during term of probation.  If defendant is revoked, all related surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Steve P., Jeanette T., Darryl H., Willie M., Donte C.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Matter set for a Restitution Hearing.  Spanish Interpreter will be needed for the victim

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Defendant Calvin D Marlow in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Calvin D Marlow in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to both counts and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on both counts as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Court to use as a read-in uncharged offenses stemming from Wauwatosa Police incident reports:  1507111 with an offense date of 3/11/15 and 15004611 with an incident date of 2/20/15  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Calvin D Marlow in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

BRANCH 26 FOR BRANCH 21.  Defendant Calvin D Marlow in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer for Vincent Guimont.  James C. Griffin  for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Jacob Haller.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  Court ordered the defendant be monitored in INTENSIVE SUPERVISON with Justice Point.  Defendant ordered to work with Justice Point resources immediately on a treatment plan.   Case remains calendared for Plea and sentencing on July 15, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 21.

Defendant Calvin D Marlow not in court.  Deann Heard for Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Guimont was present in Court this morning and informed the Court that he was informed by the defendant's family that the defendant was on his way to Court.
Case is called on the record at approximately 3:34 pm.  
 Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identifed, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 3/24/15.
